Mumbai, Maharashtra10+ years experienceBusiness Function
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.
Responsibilities
Key Accountabilities, KPIs and Job Responsibilities-:
Following are the key deliverables/tracks for the role.
1. Continuously work with business, credit policy and technology teams to improve strategies, identify and plug leakages and drive automated decision making
2. End-to-end ownership of all risk scorecard and model driven strategies across all products
3. Develop and maintain expertise (individually or within the team) to implement risk models in rule engine
4. Track all risk model performance through periodic MIS
5. Optimal use of objective bureau information in the current decision-making framework
6. Help establish clear risk reward measurement based customer strategy with a risk based pricing framework
7. Proactive identification & implementation of process changes, training needs & technology upgrades in partnership w/BAU teams
8. Stakeholder & talent management
a. Timely identification of resource requirements and onboarding + retention of selected team
b. Manage & supervise team, maintaining team productivity and motivation levels
c. Creating knowledge depth in the team by regular training & knowledge assessments, upskilling – to aid in business continuity
d. Constant compliance to laid down training & certification requirements
e. Maintaining professional & cordial working relationships with various business and support functions
Experience-: Experience of working in risk analytics for asset business in a bank / FI Exposure to and familiarity with technology solutions for banking and of industry trends Knowledge of Indian banking and regulatory guidelines Minimum 10 years experience in analytics Experience of multi-tasking, managing multiple stakeholders and independently having CXO level interactions Analytics tool expertise (SAS mandatory)
Requirements
Competencies, traits & desired levels of proficiency:
1. Problem solving - HIGHLY ADVANCED
2. Multi-tasking in high complexity & time critical situations - HIGHLY ADVANCED
3. Self driven - ADVANCED
4. Planning & organising - ADVANCED
5. Change / innovation orientation - HIGHLY ADVANCED
6. Ownership of result - HIGHLY ADVANCED
7. Teamwork & collaboration – HIGHLY ADVANCED
8. Communication - ADVANCED
9. Leadership - ADVANCED
10. Developing & Coaching - ADVANCED
11. Business Focus - ADVANCED
12. Customer Focus - ADVANCED

Business Analytics - (YES000231)
Description

Position
Business MIS / Analytics
Grade
Manager
Business Unit
Branch Banking
Sub Unit
Reporting to
Reviewer
Responsibilities
Would be responsible for identification, creation and automation of meaningful and relevant analytics and MIS for the central program team with the objective of tracking performance and driving business growth across the bank
Will be required to create various analytics reports, dashboards and MIS to measure, monitor and track performance across customer, branch, and overall bank level for the relevant teams for the channel as well as the top management
Should be able to collaborate and work with various teams in the organization including Finance, Technology and Program team for requirement definition, data acquisition, report design and roll out on a regular basis
Should be able to proactively analyze, ideate and identify new parameters/ presentation styles to make analytics reports more relevant for all the stakeholders
Should be able to standardize and automate all analytics reports to ensure standardization, consistency and TAT adherenceQualifications

Age:
Minimum 25 to Maximum 30 yearsEducation:
Graduation

Good written and verbal communication skills
Good networking & interpersonal skills
Knowledge of banking products data will be an added advantage

Bengaluru, Karnataka5+ years experienceThe Internal Controls Business Analytics Team Leader will be responsible for leading the operations, planning and execution of strategic priorities in an organized, disciplined and predictable fashion. This leader will be a critical partner to define and manage priorities, drive planning and accountability, and constantly manage expectations and ensure forward progress. In other words, ensure delivery team's high performance and teamwork culture, and strong relationship with stakeholders.This position also incorporates a high degree of relationship management, ensuring resources are fully optimized and aligned to meet strategic objectives. This Manager must be highly action oriented to creatively manage multiple high-profile programs simultaneously.Primary Job Responsibilities:
Lead an extremely talented team building efficient, highly scalable, configurable solutions spanning multiple technologies and platforms.
Provide leadership that produces a high-performing team enabling growth in professional development of team members.
Provide leadership in addition to facilitating the team through the appropriate strategy and planning discussions.
Resolve staff and project issues, communicate status and coordinate activities with peer teams across geographies.
Develop effective, matrixed, cross-organization relationships, collaborating and communicating across business and technology stakeholders and multiple geographies.
Influence both peers and leaders, to build consensus while dealing with ambiguity, and make or delegate decisions when necessary
Implement complex projects dealing with the considerable data that will meet business expectations on scope, cost and schedule.Job Requirements:
5-7 years relevant experience in technology management, leading technology teams in a high growth/high velocity environment.
Strong understanding of database principles, SQL, and experience working with big data warehouse or data lake;
Good understanding on Agile methodology and experience on scrum master is a plus;
Demonstrated aptitude for risk identification and mitigation
Effective people management and development skills at all levels, including strong capability in relating to technical staff.
Ability to collaborate effectively with remote teams across geographies and time zones is essential.
Comfortable working in an agile environment and with cross-functional teams, should have appetite to learn and be flexible to pick up new technology.
Customer focused individual with proven experience in delivering complex analysis within short time frames, managing multiple stakeholders.
Organized, deliberate, and reliable in structuring work, and effective as a problem solver.
Bachelors/Master's Degree in relevant field preferred

job_title: Specialist / Assistant Manager - Information Technology - Business Analytics & Reporting
job_description:
Chennai, Tamil NaduContract4+ years experienceCMA CGM, founded by Jacques R. Saadé, is a leading worldwide shipping group. Its 504 vessels call more than 420 ports in the world on all 5 continents. In 2017, they carried 18.9 million TEUs (twenty-foot equivalent units).
Now headed by Rodolphe Saadé, CMA CGM enjoys a continuous growth and keeps innovating to offer its customers new maritime, terrestrial, and logistical solutions.
With a presence in 160 countries and through its 755 agencies network, the Group employs more than 30,000 people worldwide, including 2,400 in its headquarters in Marseilles.Responsibilities
Reporting and Analytics
Develop Dashboards based on Qlik Sense / Qlikview at various timelines as decided by Business.
Support Existing Qlik View & Qlik Sense Dashboards.
Develop and Support ETL Packages on SSIS
Database Management which involves Extraction and Consolidation of data from various data sources via SQL, Cognos and Flat Files etc.
Coordinate/Communicate with different Agencies/Departments of CMA-CGM and collect relevant information which is used in the reporting activity
Receive, Analyse and Resolve queries regarding Dashboards/KPI Reports from Global/Internal Stakeholders.
Key Deliverables
Develop and Publish error free Dashboard
Receive, Analyse and Resolve queries raised by user within timelines agreed as per SLA
Continually improve current process w.r.t. turnaround time and create new KPIs or reportsProfile:
Education : Graduate in Computer stream (BSc IT / BCS)
Experience : 4 to 10 years
Must have good hands-on experience in:
Qlik Sense / Qlik View
SSIS or relevant ETL Tool
MS SQL
MS Excel
Should possess good structured problem-solving skills in investigating queries from Agencies and implementing automated solutions
Should possess good analytical skills in reading and interpreting reports
Good Interpersonal skillsCome along on CMA CGM’s adventure

As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. Summary
Founded in Chicago in 1889, Northern Trust is one of the world’s leading financial institutions. We specialize in providing asset servicing solutions and asset management to both institutional and personal clients. The delivery of products and services to this client base is supported through a network of offices in more than 40 countries around the globe.
We believe our most valuable asset is our engaged, empowered and diverse workforce. As a global institution, Northern Trust is committed to building upon this diverse talent through encouraging innovative thinking and personal courage in an inclusive environment. Northern Trust’s commitment to diversity and inclusion is evident in our internal initiatives for which we have won several globally recognized awards.
In this technological driven financial world, foundational decision are made and supported by data. Here at Northern Trust to support and implement the data analytics strategy in the Audit Services (AS) department, a new highly visible Data Analytics (DA) team is being formed that will be centralized with a physical presence in Chicago and India. Therefore, Northern Trust is seeking a highly skilled professional to utilize and develop their skills as a Data Analytics Engineer. Responsibilities will consist primarily of working in a highly collaborative team environment to define requirements, perform analysis, and design and build robust data analytics solutions that meet business and department specifications. This will include the use of data staging techniques, Extract Transform Load (ETL) processing, statistical modeling, utilizing advanced analytical tools to create automation with repeatable patterns, recording data governance and linage, and establishing tests across analytical sets to drive data assurance. The Data Analytics Engineer must also be able to communicate well with both business owners and AS professionals to establish and understand concurrent targets from a data perspective.
Major Duties
Analyze and understand Northern Trust’s core business processes and how the data flows end to endStrong knowledge of relational database concepts and structures, data integration techniques, ETL processes, and business analytics best practicesDesign, develop, and implement complex ETL processes utilizing necessary statistical models and toolsDevelop complex queries against normalized and dimensional models using consistent data patternsDevelop necessary cleansed and normalized datasets for complete analysis within business processesCreate analytical datasets that integrate into necessary models and dashboards for analytical insight derivationWork closely with AS partners to analyze and document requirements for analytical solutionsWrite necessary query and extraction code to create datasets required for advanced analyticsUtilize expert problem-solving and analytic skills to rapidly create ad-hoc queries to answer complex business questions or identify data issuesWork in a fast paced environment with ever changing data needs, updating datasets as needed if issues are identifiedCreate, execute, and comprehend AS testing philosophies to drive and support businessExperience & Qualifications
Technical Skills Required:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistical Analysis, or equivalent requiredStrong knowledge of relational database concepts and structures, data integration techniques, ETL processes / automation and SQL best practicesExpertise with querying data warehouses, decision support, or ETL tools (e.g., Abintio, Informatica, DataStage, SSRS)Ability to manipulate large amounts of data for analytical projects using appropriate tools (e.g.; SQL, Microsoft Business Intelligence Suite, R, Python, Spark, H2O)5-7 years of experience in designing and coding ETL or architecting and implementing data models
Personal Skills Required:Strong analytical and problem solving skillsKnowledge and understanding of data reporting workflowsHighly developed mathematical skills requiredStrong financial acumen and ability to work across multiple business unitsAbility to foster a positive and collaborative environmentAble to effectively adapt to highly dynamic and fast paced work environmentSense of ownership and urgency, with ability to work both independently and as part of teamHighly organized and able to function with multiple targets in a deadline driven environmentGood oral and written communication skills
Additional Preferred Competencies:Masters in Statistical Analysis, or Business AdministrationExperience and knowledge in supporting or participating within an internal/external audit functionKnowledge in a data quality and profiling tools a plus (e.g., Talend, SSIS, Paxata, Ataccama, Alation)Prior experience with statistical software or other data mining tools (e.g., SPSS, SAS, ODM, Vertica)Experience using BI tools for insight creation and analytic support (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, COGNOS, Microstrategy, Spotfire)3+ years of experience with data analysis or data automation2+ years of relevant experience developing business intelligence, decision support solutions, or creating reporting visualizations24 Months as a Technical Coordinator /Associate Consultant to move as a Team Leader /ConsultantMovement within TL and Consultant Level will be 12 months

2. Multi-tasking in high complexity & time critical situations - HIGHLY ADVANCED

Mumbai, Maharashtra10+ years experienceBusiness Function
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.
Responsibilities
Key Accountabilities, KPIs and Job Responsibilities-:
Following are the key deliverables/tracks for the role.
1. Continuously work with business, credit policy and technology teams to improve strategies, identify and plug leakages and drive automated decision making
2. End-to-end ownership of all risk scorecard and model driven strategies across all products
3. Develop and maintain expertise (individually or within the team) to implement risk models in rule engine
4. Track all risk model performance through periodic MIS
5. Optimal use of objective bureau information in the current decision-making framework
6. Help establish clear risk reward measurement based customer strategy with a risk based pricing framework
7. Proactive identification & implementation of process changes, training needs & technology upgrades in partnership w/BAU teams
8. Stakeholder & talent management
a. Timely identification of resource requirements and onboarding + retention of selected team
b. Manage & supervise team, maintaining team productivity and motivation levels
c. Creating knowledge depth in the team by regular training & knowledge assessments, upskilling – to aid in business continuity
d. Constant compliance to laid down training & certification requirements
e. Maintaining professional & cordial working relationships with various business and support functions
Experience-: Experience of working in risk analytics for asset business in a bank / FI Exposure to and familiarity with technology solutions for banking and of industry trends Knowledge of Indian banking and regulatory guidelines Minimum 10 years experience in analytics Experience of multi-tasking, managing multiple stakeholders and independently having CXO level interactions Analytics tool expertise (SAS mandatory)
Requirements
Competencies, traits & desired levels of proficiency:
1. Problem solving - HIGHLY ADVANCED
2. Multi-tasking in high complexity & time critical situations - HIGHLY ADVANCED
3. Self driven - ADVANCED
4. Planning & organising - ADVANCED
5. Change / innovation orientation - HIGHLY ADVANCED
6. Ownership of result - HIGHLY ADVANCED
7. Teamwork & collaboration – HIGHLY ADVANCED
8. Communication - ADVANCED
9. Leadership - ADVANCED
10. Developing & Coaching - ADVANCED
11. Business Focus - ADVANCED
12. Customer Focus - ADVANCED

Bengaluru, Karnataka5+ years experienceThe Internal Controls Business Analytics Team Leader will be responsible for leading the operations, planning and execution of strategic priorities in an organized, disciplined and predictable fashion. This leader will be a critical partner to define and manage priorities, drive planning and accountability, and constantly manage expectations and ensure forward progress. In other words, ensure delivery team's high performance and teamwork culture, and strong relationship with stakeholders.This position also incorporates a high degree of relationship management, ensuring resources are fully optimized and aligned to meet strategic objectives. This Manager must be highly action oriented to creatively manage multiple high-profile programs simultaneously.Primary Job Responsibilities:
Lead an extremely talented team building efficient, highly scalable, configurable solutions spanning multiple technologies and platforms.
Provide leadership that produces a high-performing team enabling growth in professional development of team members.
Provide leadership in addition to facilitating the team through the appropriate strategy and planning discussions.
Resolve staff and project issues, communicate status and coordinate activities with peer teams across geographies.
Develop effective, matrixed, cross-organization relationships, collaborating and communicating across business and technology stakeholders and multiple geographies.
Influence both peers and leaders, to build consensus while dealing with ambiguity, and make or delegate decisions when necessary
Implement complex projects dealing with the considerable data that will meet business expectations on scope, cost and schedule.Job Requirements:
5-7 years relevant experience in technology management, leading technology teams in a high growth/high velocity environment.
Strong understanding of database principles, SQL, and experience working with big data warehouse or data lake;
Good understanding on Agile methodology and experience on scrum master is a plus;
Demonstrated aptitude for risk identification and mitigation
Effective people management and development skills at all levels, including strong capability in relating to technical staff.
Ability to collaborate effectively with remote teams across geographies and time zones is essential.
Comfortable working in an agile environment and with cross-functional teams, should have appetite to learn and be flexible to pick up new technology.
Customer focused individual with proven experience in delivering complex analysis within short time frames, managing multiple stakeholders.
Organized, deliberate, and reliable in structuring work, and effective as a problem solver.
Bachelors/Master's Degree in relevant field preferred

Expert knowledge of Excel, SQL,Tableau,R etc.
Basic knowledge of supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms
Good to have - Python
Preferably worked in an inhouse analytics team for a mid sized startup before or analytics consulting firms

Gurgaon, HaryanaThis is a Band 28 role:
American Express is a global services company and the world’s largest card issuer. Our direct relationships with many millions of consumers, businesses and merchants worldwide - combined with our leading edge marketing, information management and rewards capabilities - enable us to offer an array of valuable services that enrich lives, build business success, encourage financial responsibility and create communities of people with common interests.
American Express for 9th consecutive year has been voted among India’s top 10 workplaces by the Great Place to Work institute. In recognition of our consistent performance, we were nominated to the Great Place to Work “Hall of Fame”.
At American Express, we serve customers, not transactions. We’re widely known for providing superior customer service and have been recognized for a number of achievements including being ranked highest in customer satisfaction within the credit card industry by J.D. Power for seven consecutive years.
A career at American Express is rich in experience and offers opportunities to build lasting relationships with our customers.
Come join us and realize your potential.
Job Description:
Function Description: To carryout Regulatory Self Testing for Global markets for GMNS OE business as per the compliance annual plan simultaneously adhering to the regulatory guidelines
Purpose of the Role: To perform Regulatory Business Self Testing by partnering with GMNS Operational Excellence team to deliver on the year on year goals
Responsibilities:Conducting testing for all regions and sound knowledge of Country specific nuancesManaging Timelines on the BAU testing, month on month submission of testsConsistently understand and interpret testing requirementsBe able to provide sound judgment when undertaking testing and also be able to interpret the results and provide analysis
Be able to support communication to the regional testing and business teamsDevising organized structure for keeping information flow, repositories of important notes and documents and exceptions. Track deliverables, deadlines and reminders
Qualifications
QUALIFICATIONS:
Critical Factors to Success:Proven robust problem solving skillsMultitasking and Time managementMobilize cross functional teams and leverage authority in a highly matrixed organization that has a presence across the globeKnowledge of Amex business & systemsAbility to build relationshipsKnowledge of foreign Language (e.g. Spanish, Italian, French etc.) is an advantage but NOT MANDATORY
Past Experience: Should have exposure to Risk and Compliance
Academic Background: Graduate/Post Graduation with at least 0-2 years of experience in Regulatory environment
Functional Skills/Capabilities:Excellent problem solving skills (issue identification, problem structuring, analysis, development of recommendationsDemonstrated analytical skills including the ability to think through all aspects of problems and generate possible courses of action
Technical Skills/Capabilities: MS-Excel, MS-Access & PowerPoint
Behavioral Skills/Capabilities:Enterprise Leadership BehaviorsSet The Agenda: Define What Winning Looks Like, Put Enterprise Thinking First, Lead with an External PerspectiveBring Others With You: Build the Best Team, Seek & Provide Coaching Feedback, Make Collaboration EssentialDo It The Right Way: Communicate Frequently, Candidly & Clearly, Make Decisions Quickly & Effectively, Live the Blue Box Values, Great Leadership Demands Courage

Work closely with data engineers, BI and UI specialists and deliver top notch analytical solution for the bank.

He/she would be developing statistical/machine learning models using various techniques (supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised) and technologies including but not limited to SAS, R, Python, Spark, H2O, Aster etc.
Work closely with data engineers, BI and UI specialists and deliver top notch analytical solution for the bank.

Advance Excel skills

Experience with structured data and semi-structured text or Excel files
Business Intelligence

Business Analytics

Trend Analysis , forecasting and pattern recognition
Find opportunities in the data and able to communicate to the partners

Market Job Description
About Enterprise Global Services
Enterprise Global Services (EGS) enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. EGS operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about EGS at our International Careers website.Department Overview
Knowledge Services brings a Team Member-based approach to the international talent pool focusing on analytical requirements. Knowledge Services (KS), encompasses roles that deliver insights and analysis based on skills, experience and judgment. Team Members exercise this judgment under general direction versus rule-driven processing. Processes and services performed in this area tend to be based on skills, domain knowledge and intellectual capability.
EADS is Wells Fargo’s hub for a distributed, diverse and effective Analytics function. EADS facilitates cross-Enterprise practices, enables innovation and provides foundational capabilities to advance analytic practice and its impact across the Company. The objective of EADS is to mature analytics at Wells Fargo and deliver value through strategically significant partnerships, customer insights, and community leadership:About the Role:
Analytic Consultant/Data Scientist is a partner-facing role and is responsible for delivering high impact analytic and data science projects by using analytics, in support of operational risk initiatives across consumer lending. This role supports analytics requirements for Credit Bureau Oversight and Quality reporting along with reporting for Issues Management.
EADS is the central analytics group tasked with solving high-impact business challenges and standing up cutting-edge analytical capabilities to be shared across Wells Fargo’s analytic community.
We are looking for a high performer to join our team and help us solve challenging and interesting business problems through rigorous data analysis and predictive modeling. In this highly consultative and visible role, you will support development analytic projects from multiple business lines using various technology and techniques ranging from but not limited to supervised, unsupervised and semi-supervised machine learning, deep-learning, NLP, optimization algorithms in both edge nodes and in big data environments (like hortonworks, MapR, Aster etc.)Responsibilities:
Person would be required to work individually or as part of a team on data science projects and work closely with business partners across the organization.
He/she would be developing statistical/machine learning models using various techniques (supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised) and technologies including but not limited to SAS, R, Python, Spark, H2O, Aster etc.
Work closely with data engineers, BI and UI specialists and deliver top notch analytical solution for the bank.

Market Job Description
About Enterprise Global Services
Enterprise Global Services (EGS) enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. EGS operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about EGS at our International Careers website.Department Overview
Knowledge Services brings a Team Member-based approach to the international talent pool focusing on analytical requirements. Knowledge Services (KS), encompasses roles that deliver insights and analysis based on skills, experience and judgment. Team Members exercise this judgment under general direction versus rule-driven processing. Processes and services performed in this area tend to be based on skills, domain knowledge and intellectual capability.
EADS is Wells Fargo’s hub for a distributed, diverse and effective Analytics function. EADS facilitates cross-Enterprise practices, enables innovation and provides foundational capabilities to advance analytic practice and its impact across the Company. The objective of EADS is to mature analytics at Wells Fargo and deliver value through strategically significant partnerships, customer insights, and community leadership:About the Role:
Analytic Consultant/Data Scientist is a partner-facing role and is responsible for delivering high impact analytic and data science projects by using analytics, in support of operational risk initiatives across consumer lending. This role supports analytics requirements for Credit Bureau Oversight and Quality reporting along with reporting for Issues Management.
EADS is the central analytics group tasked with solving high-impact business challenges and standing up cutting-edge analytical capabilities to be shared across Wells Fargo’s analytic community.
We are looking for a high performer to join our team and help us solve challenging and interesting business problems through rigorous data analysis and predictive modeling. In this highly consultative and visible role, you will support development analytic projects from multiple business lines using various technology and techniques ranging from but not limited to supervised, unsupervised and semi-supervised machine learning, deep-learning, NLP, optimization algorithms in both edge nodes and in big data environments (like hortonworks, MapR, Aster etc.)Responsibilities:
Person would be required to work individually or as part of a team on data science projects and work closely with business partners across the organization.
He/she would be developing statistical/machine learning models using various techniques (supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised) and technologies including but not limited to SAS, R, Python, Spark, H2O, Aster etc.
Work closely with data engineers, BI and UI specialists and deliver top notch analytical solution for the bank.

Enterprise Global Services (EGS) enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. EADS is Wells Fargo’s hub for a distributed, diverse and effective Analytics function. Analytic Consultant/Data Scientist is a partner-facing role and is responsible for delivering high impact analytic and data science projects by using analytics, in support of operational risk initiatives across consumer lending. This role supports analytics requirements for Credit Bureau Oversight and Quality reporting along with reporting for Issues Management.
EADS is the central analytics group tasked with solving high-impact business challenges and standing up cutting-edge analytical capabilities to be shared across Wells Fargo’s analytic community.

Work closely with data engineers, BI and UI specialists and deliver top notch analytical solution for the bank.

About Enterprise Global Services
Enterprise Global Services (EGS) enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. EGS operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about EGS at our International Careers website.Department Overview
Knowledge Services brings a Team Member-based approach to the international talent pool focusing on analytical requirements. Knowledge Services (KS), encompasses roles that deliver insights and analysis based on skills, experience and judgment. Team Members exercise this judgment under general direction versus rule-driven processing. Processes and services performed in this area tend to be based on skills, domain knowledge and intellectual capability.
EADS is Wells Fargo’s hub for a distributed, diverse and effective Analytics function. EADS facilitates cross-Enterprise practices, enables innovation and provides foundational capabilities to advance analytic practice and its impact across the Company. The objective of EADS is to mature analytics at Wells Fargo and deliver value through strategically significant partnerships, customer insights, and community leadership:About the Role:
Analytic Consultant/Data Scientist is a partner-facing role and is responsible for delivering high impact analytic and data science projects by using analytics, in support of operational risk initiatives across consumer lending. This role supports analytics requirements for Credit Bureau Oversight and Quality reporting along with reporting for Issues Management.
EADS is the central analytics group tasked with solving high-impact business challenges and standing up cutting-edge analytical capabilities to be shared across Wells Fargo’s analytic community.
We are looking for a high performer to join our team and help us solve challenging and interesting business problems through rigorous data analysis and predictive modeling. In this highly consultative and visible role, you will support development analytic projects from multiple business lines using various technology and techniques ranging from but not limited to supervised, unsupervised and semi-supervised machine learning, deep-learning, NLP, optimization algorithms in both edge nodes and in big data environments (like hortonworks, MapR, Aster etc.)Responsibilities:
Person would be required to work individually or as part of a team on data science projects and work closely with business partners across the organization.
He/she would be developing statistical/machine learning models using various techniques (supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised) and technologies including but not limited to SAS, R, Python, Spark, H2O, Aster etc.
Work closely with data engineers, BI and UI specialists and deliver top notch analytical solution for the bank.

Summary
Founded in Chicago in 1889, Northern Trust is one of the world’s leading financial institutions. We specialize in providing asset servicing solutions and asset management to both institutional and personal clients. The delivery of products and services to this client base is supported through a network of offices in more than 40 countries around the globe.

As a global institution, Northern Trust is committed to building upon this diverse talent through encouraging innovative thinking and personal courage in an inclusive environment. Northern Trust’s commitment to diversity and inclusion is evident in our internal initiatives for which we have won several globally recognized awards.
In this technological driven financial world, foundational decision are made and supported by data. Here at Northern Trust to support and implement the data analytics strategy in the Audit Services (AS) department, a new highly visible Data Analytics (DA) team is being formed that will be centralized with a physical presence in Chicago and India. Therefore, Northern Trust is seeking a highly skilled professional to utilize and develop their skills as a Data Analytics Engineer. Responsibilities will consist primarily of working in a highly collaborative team environment to define requirements, perform analysis, and design and build robust data analytics solutions that meet business and department specifications. This will include the use of data staging techniques, Extract Transform Load (ETL) processing, statistical modeling, utilizing advanced analytical tools to create automation with repeatable patterns, recording data governance and linage, and establishing tests across analytical sets to drive data assurance. The Data Analytics Engineer must also be able to communicate well with both business owners and AS professionals to establish and understand concurrent targets from a data perspective.

Technical Skills Required:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistical Analysis, or equivalent requiredStrong knowledge of relational database concepts and structures, data integration techniques, ETL processes / automation and SQL best practicesExpertise with querying data warehouses, decision support, or ETL tools (e.g., Abintio, Informatica, DataStage, SSRS)Ability to manipulate large amounts of data for analytical projects using appropriate tools (e.g.; SQL, Microsoft Business Intelligence Suite, R, Python, Spark, H2O)5-7 years of experience in designing and coding ETL or architecting and implementing data models
Personal Skills Required:Strong analytical and problem solving skillsKnowledge and understanding of data reporting workflowsHighly developed mathematical skills requiredStrong financial acumen and ability to work across multiple business unitsAbility to foster a positive and collaborative environmentAble to effectively adapt to highly dynamic and fast paced work environmentSense of ownership and urgency, with ability to work both independently and as part of teamHighly organized and able to function with multiple targets in a deadline driven environmentGood oral and written communication skills

About Enterprise Global Services
Enterprise Global Services (EGS) enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. Knowledge Services brings a Team Member-based approach to the international talent pool focusing on analytical requirements. Knowledge Services (KS), encompasses roles that deliver insights and analysis based on skills, experience and judgment. EADS is Wells Fargo’s hub for a distributed, diverse and effective Analytics function. EADS is the central analytics group tasked with solving high-impact business challenges and standing up cutting-edge analytical capabilities to be shared across Wells Fargo’s analytic community.

Bengaluru, KarnatakaDepartment Description:
The Firmwide Regulatory Reporting & Analysis (FRRA) team resides within Corporate Finance. The group is responsible for the execution and delivery against the Firm’s regulatory reporting requirements to its U.S. regulators. The team has end-to-end responsibility for US regulatory reporting and capital stress testing, including the design, implementation, and oversight of the execution, analysis, control and governance frameworks. Its mandate includes determining the appropriate investment in people, processes and technology to improve the accuracy, completeness and consistency of the Firm’s US regulatory reporting and capital stress testing submissions, as well as the implementation of new requirements and guidelines as they are published.The objectives of the FRRA Team are to provide leadership on all aspects of US regulatory reporting and Firmwide capital stress-testing, including both internal and regulatory requirements.
The Strategy and Analytics team sits within FRRA and is responsible for leading the development and implementation of Business Intelligence & Data Analytics solutions, identifying and delivering process automation & technology innovation, managing the e2e quarterly-reporting production close, and helping to define and design multi-year business strategy.
Strategy & Analytics Associate
The Strategy & Analytics Associate will report to the Analytics team lead and oversee/mentor additional local team member to support the following:
Define and maintain data taxonomy of key business metrics
Drive standardization across processes and reporting. Suggest and implement controls to improve efficiency & accuracy of existing processes
Extract, categorize, and store business information from a variety of firmwide systems
Support data models and workflows using tools such as R, Python, Alteryx, or Power Query
Work with stakeholders across FRRA to assist business-specific processes to collect useful information in tools as SharePoint
Enhance and maintain QlikView/Tableau dashboards to succinctly present key performance indicators to key business stakeholders
This role requires strong operational/process management skills to support multiple diverse processes within defined timelines while maintaining procedural and control discipline. The role provides exposure to various LOBs and Functions and provides an opportunity for the individual to partner with CFR, FRRA and Line of Business/functional Controller teams
Qualifications & Required Skills
The candidate for this position must have the following qualifications and skill set to perform this role:
A Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Business Analytics or related field
Experience with business intelligence and data visualization tools (QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau, Cognos)
Advanced experience and knowledge of core Microsoft Office application suite (Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint). Prior experience with Microsoft Project, Visio and SharePoint preferred.
Experience with R/Python or other statistical programming language preferred.
Familiarity with data transformation/wrangling tools (Alteryx, Xceptor)
Knowledge and understanding of relational database design, programming, database warehouse star schema design and structure.
Knowledge of statistics and basic machine learning a plus
Strong technical, interpersonal and organizational skills
Good communication abilities, both written and oral
To be considered for this role, you may be required to complete a video interview powered by HireVue

Market Job Description
About Enterprise Global Services
Enterprise Global Services (EGS) enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. EGS operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about EGS at our International Careers website.Department Overview
Knowledge Services brings a Team Member-based approach to the international talent pool focusing on analytical requirements. Knowledge Services (KS), encompasses roles that deliver insights and analysis based on skills, experience and judgment. Team Members exercise this judgment under general direction versus rule-driven processing. Processes and services performed in this area tend to be based on skills, domain knowledge and intellectual capability.
EADS is Wells Fargo’s hub for a distributed, diverse and effective Analytics function. EADS facilitates cross-Enterprise practices, enables innovation and provides foundational capabilities to advance analytic practice and its impact across the Company. The objective of EADS is to mature analytics at Wells Fargo and deliver value through strategically significant partnerships, customer insights, and community leadership:About the Role:
Analytic Consultant/Data Scientist is a partner-facing role and is responsible for delivering high impact analytic and data science projects by using analytics, in support of operational risk initiatives across consumer lending. This role supports analytics requirements for Credit Bureau Oversight and Quality reporting along with reporting for Issues Management.
EADS is the central analytics group tasked with solving high-impact business challenges and standing up cutting-edge analytical capabilities to be shared across Wells Fargo’s analytic community.
We are looking for a high performer to join our team and help us solve challenging and interesting business problems through rigorous data analysis and predictive modeling. In this highly consultative and visible role, you will support development analytic projects from multiple business lines using various technology and techniques ranging from but not limited to supervised, unsupervised and semi-supervised machine learning, deep-learning, NLP, optimization algorithms in both edge nodes and in big data environments (like hortonworks, MapR, Aster etc.)Responsibilities:
Person would be required to work individually or as part of a team on data science projects and work closely with business partners across the organization.

Work closely with data engineers, BI and UI specialists and deliver top notch analytical solution for the bank.

Bengaluru, KarnatakaWhat this job involves

You will be working closely with our sales teams to leverage existing industry research and pair with external data sources to identify prospects and drive effective sales pitches. On top of this, you will also be working with management to help improve new sales reporting and develop business analytics using data.

You will provide client research including portfolio analysis, strategy formulation, financial information extraction to support account Intel. Conduct primary and secondary research to support sales strategy and pipeline development

You will perform complex financial analysis with minimal supervision, including cash flow projections, valuation models and other financial models. Work with senior brokers to develop client deliverables and presentations which influence and provide impact for the client, including analysis of quantitative portfolio data, legal documents and industry and market specific information as it relates to the client’s business. Create and update property profiles and competitive property surveys for new listings. Prepare lease abstracts and critical date reports. Create and maintain accurate building specification sheets for team’s portfolio. Understand Brokerage business strategy, analyze business processes, propose Business Intelligence solutions and assist with various thought leadership initiatives. Participate in business development efforts by creating qualified business leads through research.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Bengaluru, Karnataka4+ years experienceBusiness Analytics & Research (BAR), established in 2006, is afast-growing, vibrant team within FMR India that provides capabilities likeData Science & AI, Investment Research and Customer and CompetitiveInsights. This role is part of the People Analytics Team underEnterprise HR of Fidelity Investments. The team is established in 2012 and hasdone several cutting-edge work
RoleDescription: Lead (People Analytics)
As a Lead, you will join the People Analytics team to help with workforceinsights at every stage of the Talent lifecycle. The functional focus of thisposition is to provide actionable insights using Employee data. You areexpected to use techniques and concepts related to Data Science, Statisticalmodelling, data mining/predictive analytics, advanced measurement, and otheranalytical techniques, to support strategic decision making. The rightcandidate would thrive on blazing new paths in employee related research; developingcomplex modeling that serves business needs, and helping HR maximize thecompany’s investment in people.
This position would also work together with other research/analyticscompetencies to provide an integrated solution to key workforce questions.
Work closely with business partners to understand project requirement and implement the same using sound data knowledge and experience
Data processing: Perform complex data extraction or processing (e.g. merging, sorting, data transformations) using Hive/Hadoop/Python/SQL, Spark is a plus
Profiling and analysis: Combine in-depth business knowledge, insights, and techniques such as data visualization, cross-tabs, statistical tests, and data mining techniques to identify insights on behavioral trends, Employee experience and employee engagement
Model development: Apply Standard Statistical techniques (statistical modeling, data mining, predictive analytics and optimization) to identify drivers of Employee Engagement/Employee attrition/Effectiveness etc. using R, Python, SAS or related statistical tool.
Handle multiple projects in parallel with an eye to final packaging or finished deliverables
Effectively communicate findings, concerns, ideas, project management elements to multiple stakeholders in an offshore-onshore environment
Working within and across teams/sub-teams

TheSkills that are Key to this role
TechnicalExpectations
Subject matter expert of Decision Sciencesareas like predictive modelling, data mining, deep-dive strategic analysis
Analytics expertise in any of the programminglanguage like R/Python and feature engineering experience in SQL/Hive is must
Sound knowledge in traditional statistical techniqueslike Survival Analysis, Linear/Logistic regression, Segmentation etc.
Expertise in machine learning techniques likeDecision trees,, Neural Network, Random Forest, SVM, KNN etc. is an addedadvantage
Experience in natural language processingbasics is also an added plus.

The Expertise we’re looking for
4-8years of relevant experience with organizations known for cutting edge/best-in-class applications relevant to Data Analytics
Post graduate degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or similar quantitative discipline or MBA from a premier school

Fidelity Investments is one of the world's largest providers of financial services. Headquartered in Boston, US, Fidelity's goal is to make financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. Privately held for nearly 70 years, Fidelity employs 45,000 associates who are focused on the long-term success of our customers. FMR (Fidelity Management & Research) India is the Global Inhouse Center of Fidelity Investments. Headquartered at Bangalore, where operations commenced in 2003, FMR India has another fully-functional unit at Chennai. To know more visit : FMR India
Location : Bangalore - EGL
Shift timings: 11 AM – 8 PM

Handle multiple projects in parallel with an eye to final packaging or finished deliverables

Working within and across teams/sub-teams

TechnicalExpectations

Job Description
Business intelligence engineer would support the analytical requirements of the Global Trade Services team. He/ she will be responsible for conducting deep dive analyses to solve complex business problems. He/ she will also be responsible for creating robust reporting frameworks to increase visibility into data and enable data driven decision making. Another key aspect of the job is to unearth insights from data to help the operations team in driving process excellence. This position requires excellent statistical and analytical abilities, good knowledge of business intelligence solutions and data engineering practices, and the ability to collaborate with various teams across compliance operations. Bengaluru, KarnatakaDepartment Description:
The Firmwide Regulatory Reporting & Analysis (FRRA) team resides within Corporate Finance. The group is responsible for the execution and delivery against the Firm’s regulatory reporting requirements to its U.S. regulators. The team has end-to-end responsibility for US regulatory reporting and capital stress testing, including the design, implementation, and oversight of the execution, analysis, control and governance frameworks. Its mandate includes determining the appropriate investment in people, processes and technology to improve the accuracy, completeness and consistency of the Firm’s US regulatory reporting and capital stress testing submissions, as well as the implementation of new requirements and guidelines as they are published.The objectives of the FRRA Team are to provide leadership on all aspects of US regulatory reporting and Firmwide capital stress-testing, including both internal and regulatory requirements.
The Strategy and Analytics team sits within FRRA and is responsible for leading the development and implementation of Business Intelligence & Data Analytics solutions, identifying and delivering process automation & technology innovation, managing the e2e quarterly-reporting production close, and helping to define and design multi-year business strategy.
Strategy & Analytics Associate
The Strategy & Analytics Associate will report to the Analytics team lead and oversee/mentor additional local team member to support the following:
Define and maintain data taxonomy of key business metrics
Drive standardization across processes and reporting. Suggest and implement controls to improve efficiency & accuracy of existing processes
Extract, categorize, and store business information from a variety of firmwide systems
Support data models and workflows using tools such as R, Python, Alteryx, or Power Query
Work with stakeholders across FRRA to assist business-specific processes to collect useful information in tools as SharePoint
Enhance and maintain QlikView/Tableau dashboards to succinctly present key performance indicators to key business stakeholders
This role requires strong operational/process management skills to support multiple diverse processes within defined timelines while maintaining procedural and control discipline. The role provides exposure to various LOBs and Functions and provides an opportunity for the individual to partner with CFR, FRRA and Line of Business/functional Controller teams
Qualifications & Required Skills
The candidate for this position must have the following qualifications and skill set to perform this role:
A Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Business Analytics or related field
Experience with business intelligence and data visualization tools (QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau, Cognos)
Advanced experience and knowledge of core Microsoft Office application suite (Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint). Prior experience with Microsoft Project, Visio and SharePoint preferred.
Experience with R/Python or other statistical programming language preferred.
Familiarity with data transformation/wrangling tools (Alteryx, Xceptor)
Knowledge and understanding of relational database design, programming, database warehouse star schema design and structure.
Knowledge of statistics and basic machine learning a plus
Strong technical, interpersonal and organizational skills
Good communication abilities, both written and oral
To be considered for this role, you may be required to complete a video interview powered by HireVue

Apply today!

Bengaluru, KarnatakaDepartment Description:
The Firmwide Regulatory Reporting & Analysis (FRRA) team resides within Corporate Finance. The group is responsible for the execution and delivery against the Firm’s regulatory reporting requirements to its U.S. regulators. The team has end-to-end responsibility for US regulatory reporting and capital stress testing, including the design, implementation, and oversight of the execution, analysis, control and governance frameworks. Its mandate includes determining the appropriate investment in people, processes and technology to improve the accuracy, completeness and consistency of the Firm’s US regulatory reporting and capital stress testing submissions, as well as the implementation of new requirements and guidelines as they are published.The objectives of the FRRA Team are to provide leadership on all aspects of US regulatory reporting and Firmwide capital stress-testing, including both internal and regulatory requirements.
The Strategy and Analytics team sits within FRRA and is responsible for leading the development and implementation of Business Intelligence & Data Analytics solutions, identifying and delivering process automation & technology innovation, managing the e2e quarterly-reporting production close, and helping to define and design multi-year business strategy.
Strategy & Analytics Associate
The Strategy & Analytics Associate will report to the Analytics team lead and oversee/mentor additional local team member to support the following:
Define and maintain data taxonomy of key business metrics
Drive standardization across processes and reporting. Suggest and implement controls to improve efficiency & accuracy of existing processes
Extract, categorize, and store business information from a variety of firmwide systems
Support data models and workflows using tools such as R, Python, Alteryx, or Power Query
Work with stakeholders across FRRA to assist business-specific processes to collect useful information in tools as SharePoint
Enhance and maintain QlikView/Tableau dashboards to succinctly present key performance indicators to key business stakeholders
This role requires strong operational/process management skills to support multiple diverse processes within defined timelines while maintaining procedural and control discipline. The role provides exposure to various LOBs and Functions and provides an opportunity for the individual to partner with CFR, FRRA and Line of Business/functional Controller teams
Qualifications & Required Skills
The candidate for this position must have the following qualifications and skill set to perform this role:
A Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Business Analytics or related field
Experience with business intelligence and data visualization tools (QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau, Cognos)
Advanced experience and knowledge of core Microsoft Office application suite (Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint). Prior experience with Microsoft Project, Visio and SharePoint preferred.
Experience with R/Python or other statistical programming language preferred.
Familiarity with data transformation/wrangling tools (Alteryx, Xceptor)
Knowledge and understanding of relational database design, programming, database warehouse star schema design and structure.
Knowledge of statistics and basic machine learning a plus
Strong technical, interpersonal and organizational skills
Good communication abilities, both written and oral

Market Job Description
About Enterprise Global Services
Enterprise Global Services (EGS) enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. EGS operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about EGS at our International Careers website.Department Overview
Knowledge Services brings a Team Member-based approach to the international talent pool focusing on analytical requirements. Knowledge Services (KS), encompasses roles that deliver insights and analysis based on skills, experience and judgment. Team Members exercise this judgment under general direction versus rule-driven processing. Processes and services performed in this area tend to be based on skills, domain knowledge and intellectual capability.
EADS is Wells Fargo’s hub for a distributed, diverse and effective Analytics function. EADS facilitates cross-Enterprise practices, enables innovation and provides foundational capabilities to advance analytic practice and its impact across the Company. The objective of EADS is to mature analytics at Wells Fargo and deliver value through strategically significant partnerships, customer insights, and community leadership:About the Role:
Analytic Consultant/Data Scientist is a partner-facing role and is responsible for delivering high impact analytic and data science projects by using analytics, in support of operational risk initiatives across consumer lending. This role supports analytics requirements for Credit Bureau Oversight and Quality reporting along with reporting for Issues Management.
EADS is the central analytics group tasked with solving high-impact business challenges and standing up cutting-edge analytical capabilities to be shared across Wells Fargo’s analytic community.
We are looking for a high performer to join our team and help us solve challenging and interesting business problems through rigorous data analysis and predictive modeling. In this highly consultative and visible role, you will support development analytic projects from multiple business lines using various technology and techniques ranging from but not limited to supervised, unsupervised and semi-supervised machine learning, deep-learning, NLP, optimization algorithms in both edge nodes and in big data environments (like hortonworks, MapR, Aster etc.)Responsibilities:
Person would be required to work individually or as part of a team on data science projects and work closely with business partners across the organization.

Work closely with data engineers, BI and UI specialists and deliver top notch analytical solution for the bank.

RoleDescription: Lead (People Analytics)
As a Lead, you will join the People Analytics team to help with workforceinsights at every stage of the Talent lifecycle. The functional focus of thisposition is to provide actionable insights using Employee data. You areexpected to use techniques and concepts related to Data Science, Statisticalmodelling, data mining/predictive analytics, advanced measurement, and otheranalytical techniques, to support strategic decision making. The rightcandidate would thrive on blazing new paths in employee related research; developingcomplex modeling that serves business needs, and helping HR maximize thecompany’s investment in people.
This position would also work together with other research/analyticscompetencies to provide an integrated solution to key workforce questions.
Work closely with business partners to understand project requirement and implement the same using sound data knowledge and experience
Data processing: Perform complex data extraction or processing (e.g. merging, sorting, data transformations) using Hive/Hadoop/Python/SQL, Spark is a plus
Profiling and analysis: Combine in-depth business knowledge, insights, and techniques such as data visualization, cross-tabs, statistical tests, and data mining techniques to identify insights on behavioral trends, Employee experience and employee engagement
Model development: Apply Standard Statistical techniques (statistical modeling, data mining, predictive analytics and optimization) to identify drivers of Employee Engagement/Employee attrition/Effectiveness etc. using R, Python, SAS or related statistical tool.
Handle multiple projects in parallel with an eye to final packaging or finished deliverables
Effectively communicate findings, concerns, ideas, project management elements to multiple stakeholders in an offshore-onshore environment
Working within and across teams/sub-teams

TheSkills that are Key to this role
TechnicalExpectations
Subject matter expert of Decision Sciencesareas like predictive modelling, data mining, deep-dive strategic analysis
Analytics expertise in any of the programminglanguage like R/Python and feature engineering experience in SQL/Hive is must
Sound knowledge in traditional statistical techniqueslike Survival Analysis, Linear/Logistic regression, Segmentation etc.
Expertise in machine learning techniques likeDecision trees,, Neural Network, Random Forest, SVM, KNN etc. is an addedadvantage
Experience in natural language processingbasics is also an added plus.

The Expertise we’re looking for
4-8years of relevant experience with organizations known for cutting edge/best-in-class applications relevant to Data Analytics
Post graduate degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or similar quantitative discipline or MBA from a premier school

Fidelity Investments is one of the world's largest providers of financial services. Headquartered in Boston, US, Fidelity's goal is to make financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. Privately held for nearly 70 years, Fidelity employs 45,000 associates who are focused on the long-term success of our customers. FMR (Fidelity Management & Research) India is the Global Inhouse Center of Fidelity Investments. Headquartered at Bangalore, where operations commenced in 2003, FMR India has another fully-functional unit at Chennai. To know more visit : FMR India
Location : Bangalore - EGL
Shift timings: 11 AM – 8 PM

Bengaluru, Karnataka6+ years experienceWells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company with $2.0 trillion in assets and offices in over 37 countries. Founded in 1852 and headquartered in San Francisco, Wells Fargo provides asset management, capital raising and advisory, financing, foreign exchange, payments, risk management, and trade finance services to support customers who conduct business in the global economy. At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We also value the viewpoints of our team members and encourage them to be their best. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Learn more at our International Careers website.
Market Job Description
About Enterprise Global Services
Enterprise Global Services (EGS) enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. EGS operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about EGS at our International Careers website.Department Overview
Knowledge Services brings a Team Member-based approach to the international talent pool focusing on analytical requirements. Knowledge Services (KS), encompasses roles that deliver insights and analysis based on skills, experience and judgment. Team Members exercise this judgment under general direction versus rule-driven processing. Processes and services performed in this area tend to be based on skills, domain knowledge and intellectual capability.
EADS is Wells Fargo’s hub for a distributed, diverse and effective Analytics function. EADS facilitates cross-Enterprise practices, enables innovation and provides foundational capabilities to advance analytic practice and its impact across the Company. The objective of EADS is to mature analytics at Wells Fargo and deliver value through strategically significant partnerships, customer insights, and community leadership:About the Role:
Analytic Consultant/Data Scientist is a partner-facing role and is responsible for delivering high impact analytic and data science projects by using analytics, in support of operational risk initiatives across consumer lending. This role supports analytics requirements for Credit Bureau Oversight and Quality reporting along with reporting for Issues Management.
EADS is the central analytics group tasked with solving high-impact business challenges and standing up cutting-edge analytical capabilities to be shared across Wells Fargo’s analytic community.
We are looking for a high performer to join our team and help us solve challenging and interesting business problems through rigorous data analysis and predictive modeling. In this highly consultative and visible role, you will support development analytic projects from multiple business lines using various technology and techniques ranging from but not limited to supervised, unsupervised and semi-supervised machine learning, deep-learning, NLP, optimization algorithms in both edge nodes and in big data environments (like hortonworks, MapR, Aster etc.)Responsibilities:
Person would be required to work individually or as part of a team on data science projects and work closely with business partners across the organization.
He/she would be developing statistical/machine learning models using various techniques (supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised) and technologies including but not limited to SAS, R, Python, Spark, H2O, Aster etc.
Work closely with data engineers, BI and UI specialists and deliver top notch analytical solution for the bank.
Market Skills and Certifications
Essential Skills:
BS degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis
6-9 years of experience
Experience with supervise , unsupervised & semi supervise learning
Experience with Deep-learning, Artificial intelligence techniques
Strong programing skill
Expertise in analytic tools : R, Python, Scala, Java, SAS
Big Data skills – Aster, Hadoop, SPARK, H20 and various big data distributions like Hortonworks and MapR
NLP, Text mining, Image/Voice processing, digital analytics, deep learning, machine learning
Data Engineering
Sql ,Teradata, Hadoop, Spark
Exploratory Data analysis
Provide exploratory data analysis using Python/R/SAS / SQL
Experience with Databases like oracle , Teradata, Sql server
Advance Excel skills
Data integration and clean up data for the usage
Experience with structured data and semi-structured text or Excel files
Business Intelligence
Tableau, Power BI, Shiny, Dash, HTML5
Business Analytics
Data mining and Insights
Trend Analysis , forecasting and pattern recognition
Find opportunities in the data and able to communicate to the partners
Consult with partners to define issues/information needs
Present findings to multiple levels of management
Ensure that analyses are delivered on time, while surpassing partner expectations
Ensure partner transparency throughout the life of the project
Proactively seek opportunities to increase the value of analysis
Strong oral and written communication and consultative skills
Have a sense of humor
Desired Skills:
Strong collaboration skills
Output deployment using appropriate technologies (HTML5, Shiny, Django)
Ability to translate analytical data into useful business information
Critical thinking and strong problem solving skills
Ability to learn the business aspects quickly
Ability to multi-task and prioritize between projects
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
We Value Diversity
At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status protected by applicable law. We comply with all applicable laws in every jurisdiction in which we operate.

RoleDescription: Lead (People Analytics)
As a Lead, you will join the People Analytics team to help with workforceinsights at every stage of the Talent lifecycle. The functional focus of thisposition is to provide actionable insights using Employee data. You areexpected to use techniques and concepts related to Data Science, Statisticalmodelling, data mining/predictive analytics, advanced measurement, and otheranalytical techniques, to support strategic decision making. The rightcandidate would thrive on blazing new paths in employee related research; developingcomplex modeling that serves business needs, and helping HR maximize thecompany’s investment in people.
This position would also work together with other research/analyticscompetencies to provide an integrated solution to key workforce questions.
Work closely with business partners to understand project requirement and implement the same using sound data knowledge and experience
Data processing: Perform complex data extraction or processing (e.g. merging, sorting, data transformations) using Hive/Hadoop/Python/SQL, Spark is a plus
Profiling and analysis: Combine in-depth business knowledge, insights, and techniques such as data visualization, cross-tabs, statistical tests, and data mining techniques to identify insights on behavioral trends, Employee experience and employee engagement
Model development: Apply Standard Statistical techniques (statistical modeling, data mining, predictive analytics and optimization) to identify drivers of Employee Engagement/Employee attrition/Effectiveness etc. using R, Python, SAS or related statistical tool.
Handle multiple projects in parallel with an eye to final packaging or finished deliverables
Effectively communicate findings, concerns, ideas, project management elements to multiple stakeholders in an offshore-onshore environment
Working within and across teams/sub-teams

TheSkills that are Key to this role
TechnicalExpectations
Subject matter expert of Decision Sciencesareas like predictive modelling, data mining, deep-dive strategic analysis
Analytics expertise in any of the programminglanguage like R/Python and feature engineering experience in SQL/Hive is must
Sound knowledge in traditional statistical techniqueslike Survival Analysis, Linear/Logistic regression, Segmentation etc.
Expertise in machine learning techniques likeDecision trees,, Neural Network, Random Forest, SVM, KNN etc. is an addedadvantage
Experience in natural language processingbasics is also an added plus.

The Expertise we’re looking for
4-8years of relevant experience with organizations known for cutting edge/best-in-class applications relevant to Data Analytics
Post graduate degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or similar quantitative discipline or MBA from a premier school

FMR (Fidelity Management & Research) India is the Global Inhouse Center of Fidelity Investments. Headquartered at Bangalore, where operations commenced in 2003, FMR India has another fully-functional unit at Chennai. To know more visit : FMR India
Location : Bangalore - EGL
Shift timings: 11 AM – 8 PM
